data.title: Department of Industry, Science and Resources
data.meta_description: The Partnership Manager will be responsible for the development and successful implementation of Questacon’s partnerships and philanthropic strategies.
data.text:
Reach your full potential through engaging work

Competitive salary including 15.4% super

Work in a diverse and inclusive department

About the department

The department plays a key role in the Australian Government’s agenda to create jobs and build a stronger, more resilient and competitive economy. Our work builds on Australia’s existing strengths, supports businesses to grow, and drives new opportunities for long-term productivity growth and prosperity. The success of the department helps Australia recover from the economic consequences of COVID‑19 and adapt to its ongoing effects. Through our work, we support the government’s economic recovery plan and help to deliver a better future for all Australians.

About Questacon

Questacon – The National Science and Technology Centre is a division of the Australian Government Department of Industry, Science and Resources. Our Vision is “a better future for all Australians through engagement with science, technology and innovation”. We deliver on that vision through our Mission “to excite and motivate people through inspirational learning experiences”. Science communication is at the heart of what we do.

About the team

Questacon’s Strategic Engagement section is responsible for working across Questacon to shape and implement our strategic engagement with the Minister’s Office, Department, Whole of Government, and key stakeholders, both nationally and internationally. The section comprises three teams focused on partnerships, communications, and monitoring and evaluation. The teams work closely together to share information, ensure alignment with strategic goals and maximise impact across Questacon and with our external stakeholders.

Our ideal candidate

Applications are sought from suitably qualified applicants wishing to be considered for the role of Partnership Manager in the Strategic Engagement section.

Our people are passionate, professional and authentic, demonstrating the best values of the APS and global museum sector. We are looking for people who will demonstrate these attributes as part of a cohesive leadership team that values creativity, experimentation, and collaborative approaches.

The Partnership Manager is a persuasive leader with a track record in the successful delivery of strategies, demonstrated ability to effectively collaborate and work across organisations, stakeholder management, an ability to manage multiple projects, and experience in the supervision and mentoring of staff.

Questacon values resilient leaders who show an inclusive approach to building relationships, to foster a positive culture and enhance our people’s capability.

Our department has a commitment to inclusion and diversity, with an ambition of being the best possible place to work. This reflects the importance we place on our people and on creating a workplace culture where each and every one of us is valued and respected for our contribution. Our ideal candidate adds to this culture and our workplace in their own way.

What you will do

Operating under the direction of the Senior Manager, Strategic Engagement, the Partnership Manager is responsible for the development and successful implementation of Questacon’s partnerships and philanthropic strategies. Duties include:

Developing and overseeing the implementation of Questacon’s partnerships and philanthropic strategies, ensuring alignment with Questacon’s strategic plan.

Identifying opportunities to enhance partnership performance and identify opportunities for future partnerships.

Undertaking environmental scans and analysis of potential philanthropic relationships.

Actively engage and participate in partnership and philanthropic activities and stakeholder management. This requires a sophisticated appreciation for relevant risks, sensitivities and broader context when dealing with both internal and external stakeholders.

Liaising with Questacon staff to ensure oversight of external relationships including international partnerships and institutional relationships.

Preparing high quality reports and ensuring compliance with contractual requirements.

Managing partnership and philanthropic policies, team and budget.

Other duties as required, appropriate to the classification level.

Eligibility

Relevant formal qualification/s (Bachelor degree minimum), or more than 5 years’ experience within these industries.

The successful applicants of this role are required to hold and maintain a valid ACT Working with Vulnerable People (WWVP) card.

To be eligible for employment in the APS and the department, candidates must be Australian Citizens.

Positions require a Baseline security clearance and successful candidates will be required to obtain and maintain a clearance at this level.

Notes

This recruitment process is being used to fill ongoing vacancies at the Executive Level 1 Level. The roles are available on a full time basis. You will work within the scope of the Department’s Enterprise Agreement and other policies. Outside of the usual pattern of work, this role may require some after-hours or weekend work, and may involve some interstate or international travel as required. This role have place-based requirements.

A merit pool may be established and used to fill future vacancies within 18 months from the date the vacancy was first advertised in the Gazette.

The department does currently offer flexible work opportunities for many roles. This vacancy is Canberra based, although flexible work arrangements may be considered. Please reach out to the contact officer to discuss this further.

How to apply

Your application must not contain any classified or sensitive information. This includes in your application responses, CV and any other documents. The selection panel may not consider applications containing classified information.

Please provide a pitch explaining how your skills, knowledge and experience will be relevant to this role and why you are the best candidate for the position. Your pitch can contain no more than 5000 characters (approximately 750 words) and should align to the key duties listed above.

Please complete your application online and provide your current CV with your application. (CVs must be in .doc, .docx, or .pdf format).

Accessible application documentation is available in other formats on request. Please contact [email protected] or (02) 6276 1235 if you require assistance with your application.

Please refer to our Applying for a position information for additional information on how to apply.

Contact Information
